Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2014 12:40PM beckystrong725 wrote: Hey ladies,  I'm late to the party, but I suppose better late than never?  I will finally be finished chemo on November 12th, hooray!!!  I was/am on Abraxane for 6 months, 3 on and 1 off.  About one month after my first cycle of chemo, my hair started falling out.  Since then my maintenance has been good old fashion shaving cream and a razor.  The peach fuzz drives me crazy!  I didn't totally lose all of my hair, I still have hair but it's all very random with bald spots.  When it does grow it's very light almost blonde on top with dark hair on the sides.  I also did not lose my eyebrows or eyelashes, but they thinned out.  I'm sure many of you have felt, I can't wait to finally be done chemo just so my hair can start growing back.  With that said, how long do you think until I can finally go hat-less?  I'm thinking it will be about 2-3 months after chemo?  Another question, do you recommend any topical hair products to use to help speed up the process?  Or should I just let my hair do it's thing, see how it starts growing back, and maybe wait to see if I should use something?  My next treatment plan will be Tamoxifen until whenever my tumors start to show any kind of change or growth.  I've seen that a side effect of Tamoxifen is hair thinning?  I'm hoping not but only time will tell.  Thanks for sharing!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53
